casebody.data:
Arthur Charles ZACK, Petitioner-Appellant, v. Charles BENSON, Camp Administrator, Stafford Federal Prison Camp, Stafford, Arizona, Respondent-Appellee. No. 71-1304. United States Court of Appeals, Ninth Circuit. Dec. 30, 1971. Terry Amdur (argued), of Amdur, Bryson, Caplan & Morton, Marina del Rey, Cal., for petitioner-appellant. ‘ Tom G. Kontos, Asst. U. S. Atty. (argued), Robert L. Meyer, U. S. Atty., David R. Nissen, Asst. U. S. Atty. and Chief, Criminal Div., Los Angeles, Cal., for respondent-appellee.

Before DUNIWAY, ELY and CHOY, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM:

The facts in this case are legally indistinguishable from those in United States v. Fox, 9 Cir., 1971, 454 F.2d 593. On the authority of that case, the judgment is

Reversed. When the mandate - goes down, the conviction shall be vacated.
